summary: Email correspondence between a First Assistant U.S. Attorney and an Assistant State Attorney regarding scheduling and coordination of Jeffrey Epstein's plea and sentencing in Palm Beach County. The federal prosecutor seeks to ensure Epstein's state court plea and sentencing occur before January 4, 2008, to comply with a federal non-prosecution agreement requiring Epstein to begin serving his sentence by that date.

persons.name: Mr. Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the criminal case and plea agreement; the correspondence discusses scheduling his plea and sentencing to comply with a federal non-prosecution agreement requiring him to begin serving his sentence by January 4, 2008.

persons.name: Judge McSorley
persons.context: State court judge presiding over the Epstein case; the federal prosecutor hopes the judge will conduct the plea and sentencing before January 4, 2008.

persons.name: First Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the main email; coordinates with state prosecutor to ensure Epstein's state court proceedings align with the federal non-prosecution agreement, requests documents, and offers federal office attendance at the plea/sentencing.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Signatory of the email; likely the same as the 'First Assistant United States Attorney' author.

persons.name: ASA
persons.context: State prosecutor handling the Epstein case in Palm Beach County; informed the federal prosecutor that the negotiated settlement is proceeding and explained the judge's requirement for a concurrent plea and sentencing.

connections.description: Prosecutors from different jurisdictions (federal and state) coordinating on the Epstein plea agreement and sentencing schedule to ensure compliance with a federal non-prosecution agreement.
Federal prosecutor overseeing compliance with a federal non-prosecution agreement involving Epstein, seeking to ensure Epstein's state court proceedings align with the agreement's terms.
State prosecutor handling the criminal case against Epstein and negotiating the state plea settlement.
Judge presiding over Epstein's state criminal case and setting the schedule for plea and sentencing.

events.title: Negotiated Epstein settlement agreement
events.description: A settlement agreement was negotiated for the Epstein case in Palm Beach County, described as 'a definite go' by the state prosecutor.

events.title: Conference with judge on Epstein case
events.description: A conference was held with the judge (likely Judge McSorley) where the judge insisted the plea and sentencing occur concurrently, not at separate dates.

events.title: Scheduled case disposition conference
events.description: A case disposition conference was set for January 7, 2008, in the Epstein case.

events.title: Agreed sentencing deadline
events.description: Date by which, per an agreement, Mr. Epstein was to begin serving his sentence. The federal prosecutor seeks a plea and sentencing before this date to allow Epstein to self-surrender and comply.

keyFacts: A federal non-prosecution agreement existed requiring Jeffrey Epstein to begin serving his sentence by January 4, 2008, contingent on state court proceedings.
The state court judge (McSorley) required Epstein's plea and sentencing to occur concurrently, not separately, causing a scheduling adjustment.
Federal prosecutors were actively coordinating with state prosecutors to ensure Epstein's state plea and sentencing occurred before January 4, 2008, to comply with the federal agreement.
The negotiated state settlement for Epstein's case was confirmed as proceeding ('a definite go') as of late October 2007.
Federal prosecutors requested copies of the state plea agreement, the Information, factual proffer, and scheduling details to monitor compliance.
